p: The analysis of phytochemicals of C. pictus has been reported that most parts of insulin plant including stem, leaves, rhizome and flowers are a diversity of primary and secondary metabolites [ 139]. Among them, there are many groups of secondary metabolites, including alkaloids, saccharides, terpenoids, glycosides, steroids, tannins, saponins, phenols, flavonoids, etc. [ 140, 141, 142, 143]. Besides the extract of this herb also contains trace elements such as K, Ca, Cr, Mn, Cu, and Zn [ 144].
